body_html:
Problem solved. According to the comments of tf.Graph() constructor, it is not thread-safe. If you create one, you should delete it if it is useless before making new processes. Default graph is an exception, it is a property of current thread.

So I add another

del temp_graph_created

to avoid the problem.
body_text:
Problem solved. According to the comments of tf.Graph() constructor, it is not thread-safe. If you create one, you should delete it if it is useless before making new processes. Default graph is an exception, it is a property of current thread.
So I add another
del temp_graph_created
to avoid the problem.
body:
Problem solved. According to the comments of `tf.Graph()` constructor, it is not thread-safe. If you create one, you should delete it if it is useless before making new processes. Default graph is an exception, it is a property of current thread.

So I add another 

```python
del temp_graph_created
```

 to avoid the problem.
